image1867×773 75 KB

Hi,How can I convert the piece that was sent from my friend into a part that I can use in the assembly?


This is the problem I face in order to use parts in the assembly sent to me

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-06-29T02:28:59.359Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":123,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":645.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":468108,"topic_slug":"share-document-in-onshape","display_username":"Moataz_azaiza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/0/e/0e0129fe6370941cb8a3dbdb39bc2f3deba2c38c.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59987,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2022"},"post_url":"/t/share-document-in-onshape/468108/1","custom_user_title":"2022","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3403380,"name":"Tom","username":"Zook","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-28T23:12:03.636Z","cooked":"

When viewing the part, there should be an option to make a copy in the upper left of the window near the name.

You may not have the right permissions. They need to check all the boxes when they shared the document.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-06-29T00:13:13.042Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":26.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468108,"topic_slug":"share-document-in-onshape","display_username":"Elliot S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/share-document-in-onshape/468108/3","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3403493,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-29T12:26:12.486Z","cooked":"

Your friend has shared the document with you as view-only. You can tell this is the case because you have the view-only toolbar on your first screenshot.

If you are view-only, there are still several ways you can use the part in your own assembly, but your friend needs to enable certain sharing options to allow that.

image1503×482 45.2 KB

If they check the Copy option (green arrow), you will see a

button in the top left corner when you open the link. If you see that button, you can make your own copy of the document and then do whatever you want with the parts.

If you don’t see the Make a copy box, your friend did not select this sharing option.

A second way you can use your friend’s part is if they select the Link document option (blue arrow). They did not select this option, because your second screenshot shows that you can’t create a linked document reference. If you ask them to check the Link document option in sharing, your second screenshot should show available parts rather than having them all grayed out with the error message.

Another way you could use the parts is if your friend selects the Export option (yellow arrow). If they selected this option, you could right-click on the part name in the part tree and the Export… option would be available. You could export the part to STEP or some other 3D type and then import that exported file into your document.

Something I noticed is that the part names in your screenshot start with 5715 and the team number you’ve set in your CD profile is 5715. Assuming that you are on the same team as your friend, you should be collaborating in Onshape as part of the same Onshape team. If your FRC team has already set up an Onshape team, you should request that they add you to the team. That would make sharing simpler.

If your FRC team has not set up an Onshape team, it would be a really good idea to do that. There are some simple instructions in the first topic of this document. There are other more detailed references available as well.
